text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Jaguar is a living room console with cartridges (CD player sold separately) released in 1993 and having a limited toy library because it has not been very successful. It was in its time the only 64-bit console, the PlayStation and Saturn being 32-bit, causing controversy. The two 64-bit processors of the Jaguar are nothing more than graphics accelerators, its graphics processor is a 32-bit and its CPU is a 16-bit at 13 MHz. With its 2 MB of RAM it displays a resolution of 720x526 pixels in 16 million colors. One of his cult games is 'Alien vs. Predator'.
